channel.title: tr on Programming Notes
channel.description: Recent content in tr on Programming Notes

item.title: Weekly Unix \#1 - tr
item.description: tr - translate TR basically stands for translate. The man page says - translate or delete character. So tr is used to manipulate the byte stream provided to it. This command again is very powerful when combined with other commands. For example you want to rename files to lower case (thought there are other methods for this), or you want to change a (or a set of) character in a file or from a live stream, this is the utility you will need.
